techmeme.title: Antenna: Spotify users are the least likely to cancel among major video or audio streaming services in the US, with a ~2% monthly churn rate, similar to Netflix (Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg)
X changes its adult content policies, formally letting users post consensual NSFW and AI content provided it is properly labeled and "not prominently displayed" (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
Microsoft plans to invest $3.21B to expand its cloud and AI infrastructure in Sweden over two years, including a pledge to train 250K people with AI skills (Reuters)
Spotify plans to raise US prices: Premium from $10.99 to $11.99 per month, Duo from $14.99 to $16.99, and Family from $16.99 to $19.99, after a July 2023 hike (Tom Warren/The Verge)
Raspberry Pi plans to sell shares at £2.60 to £2.80 each in its London IPO, aiming to raise ~£157M; existing shareholder Arm has agreed to buy $35M of shares (Swetha Gopinath/Bloomberg)
